diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Vitamin D 1/H9251-hydroxylase deficiency (Vitamin D-dependent rickets type 1)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Diagnosis was based on clinical features (rickets, hypocalcemia, and other characteristic symptoms) and laboratory findings including high alkaline phosphatase levels, increased PTH, and low or undetectable levels of 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D despite normal or elevated 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels. Patients responded positively to treatment with 1/H9251-OHD or calcitriol.
